A **two-handed sword** is a kind of [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is one of the most damaging non-[artifact weapons](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") in the game, and one of the most damaging among [two-handed](/wiki/Two-handed "Two-handed") weapons.

## Generation

[Barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian") have a 1⁄2 chance of starting the game with a [+0](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") two-handed sword as their starting sword.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Two-handed swords make up about 2.2% of randomly generated weapons (on the ground, as [death drops](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop"), and in [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop")).

One of the weapons guarded by the [ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level") has a 1⁄2 chance of being a two-handed sword, with an enchantment ranging from -1 to +3 and a 3⁄4 chance of being [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

Several monsters can be [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") two-handed swords:

- A [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") monster with a weapon attack, the ability to wield weapons and no other ruleset governing its monster starting inventory has a chance of generating with a two-handed sword, unless they are being generated on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level"): the base odds are 1⁄14 for normal monsters, 1⁄12 for a monster that is a [lord](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD") or [nasty](/wiki/Nasty "Nasty"), 1⁄10 for a monster that is an [overlord](/wiki/M2_PRINCE "M2 PRINCE") or both a lord and nasty, and 1⁄8 for a monster that is both nasty and an overlord.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)
- [Croesus](/wiki/Croesus "Croesus") is always generated with a two-handed sword.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)
- [Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), including those on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have an approximate 1.9% chance of generating with a two-handed sword before role replacements[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) - [barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian_\(player_monster\) "Barbarian (player monster)") have a 1⁄4 chance of receiving a two-handed sword in place of their initial primary weapon, bringing their odds to roughly 27%.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

## Two-handed sword skill

| Two-handed sword |                                                                                                                       |
| ---------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max              | [Role](/wiki/Role "Role")                                                                                             |
| Basic            | - [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist")                                                    |
| Skilled          | * [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight")                                                                                     |
| Expert           | - [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") |

The two-handed sword skill covers the use of two-handed swords and [tsurugi](/wiki/Tsurugi "Tsurugi"). [The Tsurugi of Muramasa](/wiki/The_Tsurugi_of_Muramasa "The Tsurugi of Muramasa") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") tsurugi that uses the skill.

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Two-handed](/wiki/Two-handed "Two-handed")*

Two-handed swords are solid early game weapons for their high damage rolls, particularly for weaker roles like [Tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist"), but [they can become a nuisance when cursed](/wiki/Two-handed#Wielding_cursed_two-handers "Two-handed") and are an unpopular choice to use past the [mid-game](/wiki/Game_stages#The_mid_game "Game stages"). The #[tip](/wiki/Tip "Tip") command can be used to get [curse removal](/wiki/Curse_removal "Curse removal") items out of a carried [bag](/wiki/Bag "Bag"), but most players will still prefer a one-handed and/or curse-resistant weapon to avoid this issue entirely.

## History

The two-handed sword first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which are based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial weapon list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

From Hack 1.0 to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), including some variants based on these versions, a two-handed sword can be [named](/wiki/Name "Name") [Orcrist](/wiki/Orcrist "Orcrist"), giving it a bonus d10 damage against [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster\) "Orc (monster)") - prior to [Hack 1.0.2](/wiki/Hack_1.0.2 "Hack 1.0.2"), naming Orcrist is not restricted to this weapon alone. In versions prior to [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), which makes artifacts unique and once-per game, it is also possible to have multiple "Orcrists" by naming two-handed swords this way.

From NetHack 3.0.0 to NetHack 3.0.10, Orcrist uses the two-handed sword as its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") - [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0") changes it to an [elven broadsword](/wiki/Elven_broadsword "Elven broadsword").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds [Deathsword](/wiki/Deathsword "Deathsword"), an artifact two-handed sword that is the second [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") for Barbarians.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), successfully untrapping a [land mine](/wiki/Land_mine "Land mine") [trap](/wiki/Trap "Trap") may generate a two-handed sword instead of a land mine item - this is a dual [pun](/wiki/Pun "Pun") on [claymore swords](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claymore "wikipedia:Claymore") and [claymore mines](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claymore "wikipedia:Claymore").

SporkHack introduces [Lifestealer](/wiki/Lifestealer "Lifestealer"), an artifact two-handed sword that functions similarly to [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") and is generated in the hands of [Vlad the Impaler](/wiki/Vlad_the_Impaler "Vlad the Impaler") - a comment in the code indicates that the choice of [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") was deliberate to try and deter players from using the artifact themselves, as two-handed weapons were still considered unpopular at the time (and still are to an extent).

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), [Thiefbane](/wiki/Thiefbane "Thiefbane") is an artifact two-handed sword carried by [One-eyed Sam](/wiki/Black_market_\(UnNetHack\)#One-eyed_Sam "Black market (UnNetHack)"), the black market proprietor.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds the [droven greatsword](/wiki/Droven_greatsword "Droven greatsword"), [white vibrozanbato](/index.php?title=White_vibrozanbato\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "White vibrozanbato (page does not exist)") and [gold-bladed vibrozanbato](/index.php?title=Gold-bladed_vibrozanbato\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gold-bladed vibrozanbato (page does not exist)") as weapons that use the two-handed sword skill.

Carrying [The Black Crystal](/wiki/The_Black_Crystal "The Black Crystal") increases a character's skill cap in two-handed swords by one. [Dantalion](/wiki/Dantalion "Dantalion") is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") that grants skill in two-handed swords while bound.

[Aurumach Rilmani](/wiki/Aurumach_Rilmani "Aurumach Rilmani") always generate with a [gold](/wiki/Gold_\(material\) "Gold (material)") two-handed sword enchanted to at least +4, and [wandering githyanki pirates](/wiki/Wandering_pirate#Githyanki_pirate "Wandering pirate") are generated with a two-handed sword.

There are many artifact two-handed swords:

- The [Atlantean Royal Sword](/wiki/Atlantean_Royal_Sword "Atlantean Royal Sword") is a neutral artifact that favors Barbarians, and is the first guaranteed sacrifice gift for Barbarians that start with a two-handed sword. It has +1d3 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and deals double damage, and automatically [shatters](/wiki/Shatter "Shatter") the wielded weapons of targets it hits - Barbarians can also wield it in the offhand.
- [Sol Valtiva](/wiki/Sol_Valtiva_\(dNetHack\) "Sol Valtiva (dNetHack)") is a chaotic [obsidian](/wiki/Obsidian "Obsidian") two-handed sword that favors [fire giants](/wiki/Fire_giant "Fire giant"), and is the signature weapon of [Lord Surtur](/wiki/Lord_Surtur "Lord Surtur").
- [Genocide](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Genocide "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful large [intelligent artifact](/wiki/Intelligent_artifact "Intelligent artifact") that is wielded by [Bael](/wiki/Bael "Bael"). It has +1d10 to-hit and deals +1d20 [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire") damage against targets without [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), while dealing +6d6 fire damage to all monsters of the same race (or monster type if race does not apply) on the current level - if a monster is killed by that fire damage, a fiery explosion that deals 6d6 damage occurs centered on the monster. While the fire damage from this secondary attack does not affect the victim's inventory, the subsequent explosion can burn items in its range.
- [Doomscreamer](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Doomscreamer "DNetHack artifacts") is a chaotic and intelligent artifact wielded by [Graz'zt](/index.php?title=Graz%27zt_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Graz'zt (dNetHack) (page does not exist)"). It has +1 to-hit and deals double damage against targets without [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"), and grants acid resistance when wielded.
- [The Sword of Onoel](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Sword_of_Onoel "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful and large intelligent artifact that is made of [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") and grants +1d7 to-hit and +1d10 damage versus all monsters. While wielded, the Sword of Onoel grants [automatic searching](/wiki/Automatic_searching "Automatic searching") and [blindness resistance](/wiki/Blindness_resistance "Blindness resistance"), and acts as a [light source](/wiki/Light_source "Light source"); targets that it strikes may be [blinded](/wiki/Blind "Blind"), [gremlins](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin") are reduced to dust, and [trolls](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)") are [petrified](/wiki/Petrified "Petrified").

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), the [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") is changed to [Sol Valtiva](/wiki/Sol_Valtiva_\(xNetHack\) "Sol Valtiva (xNetHack)"), a chaotic artifact two-handed sword made of [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril") that is the signature weapon of Lord Surtur.

### notdNetHack

In [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), in addition to dNetHack details, Dantalion is generated with an artifact two-handed sword called [The Dread of Dantalion](/wiki/The_Dread_of_Dantalion "The Dread of Dantalion") when summoned by an [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [The Sword of Kas](/wiki/The_Sword_of_Kas "The Sword of Kas") is an artifact two-handed sword that appears in the hands of [Kas](/wiki/Kas "Kas"). EvilHack also adds Lifestealer from SporkHack.

A two-handed sword is a kind of melee weapon that appears in NetHack. It is one of the most damaging non-artifact weapons in the game, and one of the most damaging among two-handed weapons.

Two-handed swords make up about 2.2% of randomly generated weapons (on the ground, as death drops, and in shops).

One of the weapons guarded by the ghost on the Rogue level has a 1⁄2 chance of being a two-handed sword, with an enchantment ranging from -1 to +3 and a 3⁄4 chance of being cursed.[3]

Several monsters can be generated with two-handed swords:

  • A strong humanoid monster with a weapon attack, the ability to wield weapons and no other ruleset governing its monster starting inventory has a chance of generating with a two-handed sword, unless they are being generated on the Rogue level: the base odds are 1⁄14 for normal monsters, 1⁄12 for a monster that is a lord or nasty, 1⁄10 for a monster that is an overlord or both a lord and nasty, and 1⁄8 for a monster that is both nasty and an overlord.[4]
  • Croesus is always generated with a two-handed sword.[5]
  • Player monsters, including those on the Astral Plane, have an approximate 1.9% chance of generating with a two-handed sword before role replacements[6] - barbarians have a 1⁄4 chance of receiving a two-handed sword in place of their initial primary weapon, bringing their odds to roughly 27%.[7]

The two-handed sword skill covers the use of two-handed swords and tsurugi. The Tsurugi of Muramasa is an artifact tsurugi that uses the skill.

Strategy

Two-handed swords are solid early game weapons for their high damage rolls, particularly for weaker roles like Tourists, but they can become a nuisance when cursed and are an unpopular choice to use past the mid-game. The #tip command can be used to get curse removal items out of a carried bag, but most players will still prefer a one-handed and/or curse-resistant weapon to avoid this issue entirely.

The two-handed sword first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which are based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, and is included in the initial weapon list for Hack 1.0.

From NetHack 3.0.0 to NetHack 3.0.10, Orcrist uses the two-handed sword as its base item - NetHack 3.1.0 changes it to an elven broadsword.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds Deathsword, an artifact two-handed sword that is the second sacrifice gift for Barbarians.

UnNetHack

dNetHack

  • Sol Valtiva is a chaotic obsidian two-handed sword that favors fire giants, and is the signature weapon of Lord Surtur.

While the fire damage from this secondary attack does not affect the victim's inventory, the subsequent explosion can burn items in its range.
  • Doomscreamer is a chaotic and intelligent artifact wielded by Graz'zt. It has +1 to-hit and deals double damage against targets without acid resistance, and grants acid resistance when wielded.
  • The Sword of Onoel is a lawful and large intelligent artifact that is made of silver and grants +1d7 to-hit and +1d10 damage versus all monsters. While wielded, the Sword of Onoel grants automatic searching and blindness resistance, and acts as a light source; targets that it strikes may be blinded, gremlins are reduced to dust, and trolls are petrified.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, the Valkyrie quest artifact is changed to Sol Valtiva, a chaotic artifact two-handed sword made of mithril that is the signature weapon of Lord Surtur.

notdNetHack

It is one of the most damaging non-[[artifact weapon]]s in the game, and one of the most damaging among [[two-handed]] weapons. ==Generation== [[Barbarian]]s have a {{frac|2}} chance of starting the game with a [[Enchantment|+0]] two-handed sword as their starting sword.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|44|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=Barbarian initial inventory}}{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|680|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=Barbarian inventory substitution; rn2(100) is used rather that rn2(2)}} Two-handed swords make up about 2.2% of randomly generated weapons (on the ground, as [[death drop]]s, and in [[shop]]s). One of the weapons guarded by the [[ghost]] on the [[Rogue level]] has a {{frac|2}} chance of being a two-handed sword, with an enchantment ranging from -1 to +3 and a {{frac|3|4}} chance of being [[cursed]].{{refsrc|src/extralev.c|328|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} Several monsters can be [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] two-handed swords: * A [[strong]] [[humanoid]] monster with a weapon attack, the ability to wield weapons and no other ruleset governing its monster starting inventory has a chance of generating with a two-handed sword, unless they are being generated on the [[Rogue level]]: the base odds are {{frac|14}} for normal monsters, {{frac|12}} for a monster that is a [[M2_LORD|lord]] or [[nasty]], {{frac|10}} for a monster that is an [[M2_PRINCE|overlord]] or both a lord and nasty, and {{frac|8}} for a monster that is both nasty and an overlord.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|527|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=Case for two-handed sword in "default" monster weapon generation}} * [[Croesus]] is always generated with a two-handed sword.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1308|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} * [[Player monster]]s, including those on the [[Astral Plane]], have an approximate 1.9% chance of generating with a two-handed sword before role replacements{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|155|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment={{frac|2}} to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds}} - [[Barbarian (player monster)|barbarians]] have a {{frac|4}} chance of receiving a two-handed sword in place of their initial primary weapon, bringing their odds to roughly 27%.{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|171|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} ==Two-handed sword skill== {{two-handed sword skill table}} The two-handed sword skill covers the use of two-handed swords and [[tsurugi]]. [[The Tsurugi of Muramasa]] is an [[artifact]] tsurugi that uses the skill. ==Strategy== {{main|Two-handed}} Two-handed swords are solid early game weapons for their high damage rolls, particularly for weaker roles like [[Tourist]]s, but [[Two-handed#Wielding cursed two-handers|they can become a nuisance when cursed]] and are an unpopular choice to use past the [[Game stages#The mid game|mid-game]]. The #[[tip]] command can be used to get [[curse removal]] items out of a carried [[bag]], but most players will still prefer a one-handed and/or curse-resistant weapon to avoid this issue entirely. ==History== The two-handed sword first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which are based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and is included in the initial weapon list for [[Hack 1.0]]. From Hack 1.0 to [[NetHack 3.0.10]], including some variants based on these versions, a two-handed sword can be [[name]]d [[Orcrist]], giving it a bonus d10 damage against [[Orc (monster)|orcs]] - prior to [[Hack 1.0.2]], naming Orcrist is not restricted to this weapon alone. In versions prior to [[NetHack 3.0.0]], which makes artifacts unique and once-per game, it is also possible to have multiple "Orcrists" by naming two-handed swords this way. From NetHack 3.0.0 to NetHack 3.0.10, Orcrist uses the two-handed sword as its [[base item]] - [[NetHack 3.1.0]] changes it to an [[elven broadsword]]. ==Variants== ===SLASH'EM=== [[SLASH'EM]] adds [[Deathsword]], an artifact two-handed sword that is the second [[sacrifice gift]] for Barbarians. ===SporkHack=== In [[SporkHack]], successfully untrapping a [[land mine]] [[trap]] may generate a two-handed sword instead of a land mine item - this is a dual [[pun]] on [[Wikipedia:Claymore|claymore swords]] and [[Wikipedia:Claymore|claymore mines]]. SporkHack introduces [[Lifestealer]], an artifact two-handed sword that functions similarly to [[Stormbringer]] and is generated in the hands of [[Vlad the Impaler]] - a comment in the code indicates that the choice of [[base item]] was deliberate to try and deter players from using the artifact themselves, as two-handed weapons were still considered unpopular at the time (and still are to an extent). ===UnNetHack=== In [[UnNetHack]], [[Thiefbane]] is an artifact two-handed sword carried by [[Black market (UnNetHack)#One-eyed Sam|One-eyed Sam]], the black market proprietor. ===dNetHack=== [[dNetHack]] adds the [[droven greatsword]], [[white vibrozanbato]] and [[gold-bladed vibrozanbato]] as weapons that use the two-handed sword skill. Carrying [[The Black Crystal]] increases a character's skill cap in two-handed swords by one. [[Dantalion]] is a [[Spirits (dNetHack)|spirit]] that grants skill in two-handed swords while bound. [[Aurumach Rilmani]] always generate with a [[Gold (material)|gold]] two-handed sword enchanted to at least +4, and [[Wandering pirate#Githyanki pirate|wandering githyanki pirates]] are generated with a two-handed sword. There are many artifact two-handed swords: * The [[Atlantean Royal Sword]] is a neutral artifact that favors Barbarians, and is the first guaranteed sacrifice gift for Barbarians that start with a two-handed sword. It has +1d3 [[to-hit]] and deals double damage, and automatically [[shatter]]s the wielded weapons of targets it hits - Barbarians can also wield it in the offhand. * [[Sol Valtiva (dNetHack)|Sol Valtiva]] is a chaotic [[obsidian]] two-handed sword that favors [[fire giant]]s, and is the signature weapon of [[Lord Surtur]]. * [[dNetHack artifacts#Genocide|Genocide]] is a lawful large [[intelligent artifact]] that is wielded by [[Bael]]. It has +1d10 to-hit and deals +1d20 [[fire]] damage against targets without [[fire resistance]], while dealing +6d6 fire damage to all monsters of the same race (or monster type if race does not apply) on the current level - if a monster is killed by that fire damage, a fiery explosion that deals 6d6 damage occurs centered on the monster. While the fire damage from this secondary attack does not affect the victim's inventory, the subsequent explosion can burn items in its range. * [[dNetHack artifacts#Doomscreamer|Doomscreamer]] is a chaotic and intelligent artifact wielded by [[Graz'zt (dNetHack)|Graz'zt]]. It has +1 to-hit and deals double damage against targets without [[acid resistance]], and grants acid resistance when wielded. * [[dNetHack artifacts#Sword of Onoel|The Sword of Onoel]] is a lawful and large intelligent artifact that is made of [[silver]] and grants +1d7 to-hit and +1d10 damage versus all monsters. While wielded, the Sword of Onoel grants [[automatic searching]] and [[blindness resistance]], and acts as a [[light source]]; targets that it strikes may be [[blind]]ed, [[gremlin]]s are reduced to dust, and [[Troll (monster class)|trolls]] are [[petrified]]. ===xNetHack=== In [[xNetHack]], the [[Valkyrie]] [[quest artifact]] is changed to [[Sol Valtiva (xNetHack)|Sol Valtiva]], a chaotic artifact two-handed sword made of [[mithril]] that is the signature weapon of Lord Surtur. ===notdNetHack=== In [[notdNetHack]], in addition to dNetHack details, Dantalion is generated with an artifact two-handed sword called [[The Dread of Dantalion]] when summoned by an [[Illithanachronounbinder]]. ===EvilHack=== In [[EvilHack]], [[The Sword of Kas]] is an artifact two-handed sword that appears in the hands of [[Kas]]. EvilHack also adds Lifestealer from SporkHack. ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Weapons]] [[Category:Skills]]
